Pre-Game Insights: Mayank Yadav is expected to showcase speed in India vs Bangladesh T20 series.
Absence of India's T20 regulars will provide opportunities to fringe players.
Delhi pacers Harshit Rana and all-rounder Nitish Kumar could make their India debut.
Shubman Gill, Rishabh Pant, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Mohammed Siraj, and Axar Patel have been rested from the T20s against Bangladesh.
Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya are key players in the squad.
Abhishek Sharma, Sanju Samson, and Riyan Parag could build their credentials.
Varun Chakaravarthy and Ravi Bishnoi are the specialist spinners in the squad.
Jitesh Sharma, the reserve wicket-keeper, has not played since the IPL in June.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh start life without Shakib Al Hasan.
Bangladesh off-spinner Mehidy Hasan Miraz has been recalled after 14 months.
Veteran batter Mahmud Ullah stands at the crossroads of his career.
Shrimant Madhavrao Scindia Stadium will make its international debut in Gwalior.
Captain Roop Singh Stadium in Gwalior hosted the last international match in 2010.
